Indian Economy.title: Women’s participation in the labour force: It’s too risky to let it languish
Indian Economy.summary: India’s economy may stay in a low equilibrium if we do not act to resolve well identified restraints on women taking up employment. A comparison of urban and rural data shows that neither setting is working for women, even if the reasons differ.

Indian Economy.title: The illusion of fiscal discipline
Indian Economy.summary: Capital flows depend on economic and geopolitical power, placing middle, low income countries at a huge disadvantage

Indian Economy.title: PSBs: Making a strong economic and social impact
Indian Economy.summary: Public sector banks, which were weighed down by NPAs till a few years, ago have turned around and have emerged stronger

Indian Economy.title: GHCL receives approval from Gujarat govt for renewal of lease for its lignite mine
Indian Economy.summary: GHCL Ltd secures 20-year lease renewal for Khadsaliya lignite mines, expanding into composite mining operation.

Indian Economy.title: SBI’s ₹25,000 cr QIP oversubscribed 4.5x, marks India’s largest-ever share sale
Indian Economy.summary: Two-thirds of the allocation went to domestic investors, including LIC, while the remaining was picked up by foreign funds, who accounted for 64.3% of total demand.

Stock Market.title: HDFC Bank stock climbs over 2% post earnings announcement
Stock Market.summary: On a standalone basis, the country's largest private sector lender reported a net profit of Rs 18,155 crore for the quarter, up from ₹16,174 crore a year ago.

Stock Market.title: Nifty Bank Prediction today – Jul 21, 2025: Room for upside today
Stock Market.summary: Nifty Bank index gains 0.8%, private banks outperforming, futures likely to rally towards 57,300, supports at 56,630 and 56,350.

Stock Market.title: Markets open flat amid trade concerns and mixed earnings; banking stocks lead gains
Stock Market.summary: Markets open lower amid trade uncertainty, banking stocks rise; analysts caution against stretched valuations and trade tensions.

Startups & Funding.title: Inside Otipy’s crash and burn: How 10-minute delivery killed a 10-year dream
Startups & Funding.summary: Agri-tech startup Otipy, which had raised $44 million, shut its operations in May. The company ran out of cash after a $10 million fundraise, from a new investor, did not come through. What changed this investor’s mind?

Startups & Funding.title: Student loan provider Avanse Financial looks to raise $250 million in private round after shelving IPO
Startups & Funding.summary: The startup filed draft papers with Sebi for an IPO last July. But after Indian companies raised a record ₹1.69 trillion through IPOs in 2024, the euphoria around public offerings appears to be softening in 2025 amid volatile market conditions.

Banking & Finance.title: Digital banking by choice, not default: RBI issues draft guidelines
Banking & Finance.summary: As per RBI’s Draft Directions on Digital Banking Channels Authorisation, banks must obtain explicit and documented consent from customers before providing any digital banking services.

Banking & Finance.title: RBI draft: Digital banking not mandatory for other services, proposes stronger fraud protection rules
Banking & Finance.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI), in an official draft, declared that banks should not mandate digital banking for users to access other services. This was among other directives which the central bank is looking to get industry views on before imposing it as …

Banking & Finance.title: Act now: Crypto regulation cannot be left for another day
Banking & Finance.summary: India urgently needs to set up a sound regulatory framework for digital assets. Sebi, RBI and the government must come together to fill the vacuum and protect millions of Indian crypto investors before it’s too late.

Banking & Finance.title: Why are banks letting a useful tool for risk management gather dust?
Banking & Finance.summary: Risk appetite statements (RAS) were meant to serve a purpose, not become another tick-box routine. To rescue the concept, banks must state their risk appetites on the basis of metrics that turn these statements into steering wheels.

Technology Sector.title: Mint Quick Edit: Time to rescue crypto from policy limbo
Technology Sector.summary: The hack suffered by Indian crypto exchange CoinDCX is a reminder to tighten cyber security. It should also nudge the government to frame a policy on digital assets, which have been in a regulatory grey zone for too long.

Technology Sector.title: Act now: Crypto regulation cannot be left for another day
Technology Sector.summary: India urgently needs to set up a sound regulatory framework for digital assets. Sebi, RBI and the government must come together to fill the vacuum and protect millions of Indian crypto investors before it’s too late.
